titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: The Times reports the death of Chancellor Aubrey T. Lawrence, at the age of 55. He gave me a copy of Cripps' 'Law relating to Church and Clergy': and had shown evidences of kindly feelings toward me, after a long spell of ignorant abhorrence!

p.hi: He gave me a woeful account of the situation in Pelton: where the Vicar, Merryweather, has been "breaking out again" in the worst ways. He is alleged to have cried "Damn the Bishops"! in the course of a sermon, & his language is scarcely sane: & yet, horribly offensive as it is, there is hardly anything actionable in it: &, hitherto, I have had no complaint from the P.P.

body.p: Pattinson and I motored to Sunderland, where I confirmed 80 persons in S. Mark's, Millfield. Before the service Wright, of S. Mary's, took me to the Infirmary, where I confirmed a sick youth in his bed. After the service in S. Mark's, we returned to Auckland.
